content.description: Start in a right-facing corner, continuing up a broken arete.  The bolts are much newer on this route vs the other two to the left.
content.protection: 4 bolts, bolt anchor (bolts are 3/8") Supplemental gear down low?
content.location: Approx halfway between Ramming Speed and Immaculate Conception.  IC is the farthest R-facing corner.  This route is the next one over.

content.description: Climb onto a flake/block leaning against the wall, then over a bulge on patina.  [per Miramontes]  Two bolts with SMC hangers.

climbs.name: Midnight Oil
climbs.fa: Mike Paul and Paul Borne, March 1988

content.protection:
Two bolts (1/4"). A couple cams and sling some protrusions up high if you're crazy enough to lead this on these old bolts. Can also be TR'd from the anchors of Vanishing point with some directionals.

Route would be negligible runout (or at least only PG13) if bolts were replaced.
content.location: This is the left-most route on that block, distinguished by 2 archaic bolts on a nice patina face.  A slight weakness extends left of the first bolt.

climbs.name: Immaculate Conception
climbs.fa: Charles Cole, Dave Evans, Dave Wonderly

content.description: Start up a crack on the inside of a low block to get up onto a big ramp.  Follow that ramp to a steep dihedral with a thin crack that widens to hand pods and bigger near the top.  Then diagonal rightward and zigzag up past nice jams and big jugs.  A mild runout above last pro up easier terrain leads to the top.
content.protection: Pro to 2.5", gear anchor or utilize the bolted anchor atop Vanishing Point.
content.location: Located on the west tip arete of Dihedral Rock, right of the bolted line of Vanishing Point.  This pinnacle summit is separate from the main formation where Coarse & Buggy and Thin Line are, with no walkoff.  Descend using bolted rap anchor of Vanishing Point.
